meanings.definition: Not currently entitled to the full rights or benefits of ownership.
meanings.sent1: The nonvested employee will receive full benefits after one year of service.
meanings.sent2: She had nonvested shares in the company, so she couldn't vote at the shareholders' meeting.
meanings.sent3: The nonvested puppy eagerly awaited his turn to play with the ball.
meanings.sent4: Her nonvested status in the club made her feel like a guest in her own home.
meanings.sent5: The nonvested treasure chest held untold riches waiting to be claimed.

meanings.sent1: The nonvested plan was still under consideration by the board.
meanings.sent2: Without a nonvested agreement, the project could not move forward.
meanings.sent3: The nonvested garden looked like a blank canvas waiting for inspiration.
meanings.sent4: His nonvested reputation in the industry made it hard for him to gain trust.
meanings.sent5: The nonvested bridge seemed fragile, as if it could collapse at any moment.
